Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, but many point of improvement”
Reviews.Author: rrooze
Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel, belonging to the Spanish Melia-group, but without the Melia-standard. plus: + location + clean + new + breakfast (but it costs 19 euro!) minus: - extremely slow reception (10 minutes to check out per person??) - you hear your neighbours through the walls - bed not very comfortable - pillows are just empty bags - no free internet - too warm all combined: reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location for some, internet access is a problem”
Reviews.Author: tritiumnyc
Reviews.Content: We were in Berlin to go party at Berghain and around the east. Most of the parties are within a few km of this hotel making it a great launching point. Enjoyed our stay here, the staff was nice, the rooms were clean. We had no internet access in our room. The hotel provides internet through T-Mobile hotspots and the hotel is not very well wired up. It was a bit annoying to have to go down to use the computer in the reception area everytime we wanted the internet. It also made iPad usage a real problem. At the price this hotel charges, they really should ensure that all rooms have WiFi...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindyloo6
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Innside hotel in August 2011, for 4 nights, specifically booked the hotel for its proximity to the Beer festival which was taking place over the weekend around the corner. The hotel rooms were large and had clean. Pillows left alot to be desired which seem to be the norm for alot of the large German hotels, large square cushions. Once you get over the shower being in the bedroom everything else was great. didnt order room service although the room menu seemed really quite reasonable. The one downside to the room was no tea and coffee making facilities which I have to say i already knew about prior to arrival but would have been a nice touch. Had a few drinks in the hotel bar which seemed to close when ever they were not too busy, which could range from 22.00 to 01.00, staff were all very helpful in both the bar and hotel. The area is not where i would normally stay in Berlin and I have stayed in most of them, there is not a great deal to do there especially at night, although some of the little bars and vans around the station didnt seem to close. Would prob stay there again for the beer festival but will go to other areas of the city on my next visit. Good flea market in the area on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolMap
Reviews.Content: First time in Berlin hotel very nice would go back here again staff very nice and helpful train station within 5 Min's walk. Hotel rooms very nice but shower set up a bit strange tho it only bothered my wife. Room large and very clean slept with windows open no noise at all. The Hotel is in a very quiet small road by some open and dark land felt a bit uneasy at first but not unsafe. There are some bars and restaurants close by but they seemed a bit seedy. Hotel bar and restaurant nice but breakfast bit expensive at 19 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanetT15
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel. Only 2 mins to the Ostbahnhof. Very clean, friendly staff and overall good value for money. Would stay again if I go back to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location but no air-con”
Reviews.Author: Sinnywinny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June and overall we had a great experience with the hotel. The rooms are modern and spacious, however there is no air-con in the rooms so you need to leave the windows open to get any bit of air into the rooms. As the weather was very warm while we were in Berlin (24C-30C) we left the windows open all day and all night! Location wise, the hotel is very conveniently located to Osbahnhof station (about 2 minute walk). This station is on the train line from the airport and only 1 stop away from the main train station (where you can get trains to Reichstag, Zoo, etc). It took us a few minutes to find the hotel when we got to the train station because the hotel is not on a main street. The area itself seemed safe and was very quiet. The breakfast was good, plenty of choice and plenty of food. The breakfast room is quite small given the size of the hotel though. There is a large garden with tables and chairs for guests to use. The bar is very expensive but I guess that's standard for all hotel bars! There is a Lidl and numerous other shops located in the train station. The only complaint we had about the hotel was that we requested a double room when booking and when we arrived we were booked into a twin room. We mentioned this to the person who checked us in and he said that our booking had come through on their system as a twin room and there were no double rooms available for the duration of our stay so we couldn't be moved. However, the next morning we mentioned to a lady at reception that we were booked in a twin room but had requested a double. She checked our booking on their system and said we should have been booked into a double room and changed rooms for us straight away! Overall we realy enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, large rooms. Good value for money. Location not great”
Reviews.Author: arbitrarydoll
Reviews.Content: Positives - Really close to a train station (Ostbahnhof). 3 min walk. - Very big room. We had room 204 and there was at least 1-2 meters of space all around the bed - Very quiet room. Our room faced onto the large internal courtyard. We slept with the windows open on a Saturday night and it was completely silent. - Very, very clean rooms. I could find no mould, dust or stains (and I looked!) - A desktop computer with Internet access in the hotel's office is available free of charge to guests.  - The staff are very helpful. I rang down to the restaurant/reception quite a few times during our stay to request things like additional pillows, bowls, tea cups, hot water to make tea etc. The staff were very nice and had the items to us in the room within 5 - 10 minutes.  Negatives - The hotel has no free wireless. Some rooms (not all) have access to the T-Mobile hotspot network which costs around €5 per hour. I did know this when I booked the hotel - but if they did have free wireless it would have made our lives a little easier. - The hotel isn't in an area with restaurants, bars, shops etc. The train station is very close (which has the usual fast food venues and a supermarket). The hotel seems to be in an area with homes and offices. I prefer to stay in a hotel that's within a 5 min walk of restaurants, cafes and shopping. The neatest cafe strip is apparently Boxhagener Platz which was 1.5 - 2km away. We didn't go there. - The bathroom does not have a door and the shower is a clear cylinder in the room. There is no privacy. This was no problem for us...but might be VERY awkward for some guests. - Irons are not available in the rooms. My husband had to go downstairs into a room where an iron and ironing board could be used. He said it had something to do with fire safety standards...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RaelsC
Reviews.Content: great hotel in a great location. Rooms were huge. Best value hotel I stayed at in Europe for a long time. I was travelling solo so it was fine, but for those travelling with friends - the shower is a glass "bowl" in the bathroom with no doors - so bear that in mind. Berlin is a great city and I would definately stay here again.-

Reviews.Title: “easy to find great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thehumpers
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel twice and now booked a third. its so easy to get to from the airport and really close to the city. The staff are fantastic can't help you enough. The rooms are so modern and if you get one of the central showers you can have a lot of fun with your other half! The bar and breakfast area are lovely, we often had a nighcap in there. Breakfast was lovely too good options and as much as you wanted. Room was cleaned every day, hotel overall is spotless throughout. Courtyard is lovely to sit in for early evening drinks before going out lovely touch like complimentery nibbles from the bar. All in all fantastic hotel, nearby local fast food is also great! Try the aisan lady in who cooks the noodles just by the station entrance. Only one thing, take your own travel kettle no tea or coffee making in the room.

Reviews.Title: “some great points and some small annoyances”
Reviews.Author: woolmerc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend for 4 nights at the start of May as part of the standard special promo on expedia. Let me list the good and the bad. good: - Extremely clean - very modern - Fantastic service (allowed us to check in at midday, was always helpful, funny, good english, and always had a smile) They told us how expensive internet was and that we could use there front desk computer for emails. They also let us print out a 14 page document for free. - Pretty good location - 5min walk to the trains - Good cheap markets nearby. - Very quiet. bad: - Strange square pillow design that I just could not get comfortable on. When asking for a different pillow which was a little harder at the front desk, they had none. - I think it is standard with European hotels but wireless internet was way too expensive - 8 Euros an hour! Lots of free wi-fi cafes in Berlin if you bring your laptop. - Bathroom is awkward - It has an open window to the bedroom, lacking a little privacy. - Room was a little tiny for a 4 star hotel. - no air conditioning and was quiet warm despite it being cool outside. Could control this by having the windows open. - It was advertised a double bed on our booking, unfortunately it was just 2 singles pushed together. It made it very hard for me and my girlfriend to get cozy with the big split down the middle. So all in all, I don't think this is a 4 star hotel. It has some exceptional elements, but others thet dissapoint me regarding the room and its comfort. But I think most people will still enjoy there stay here as it passed my main checklist of Service, Location, affordability, and cleanliness with flying colours.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service, great breakfast, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: monkeykieran
Reviews.Content: My friend with whom I was sharing a room with had stayed at the hotel before so when we checked in this was mentioned, I am not sure if this had any effect on us being upgraded to a junior suite but it was a nice gesture by a very attentuive and friendly man at check in. My friend had said that the standard room was perfectly sufficient and spacious but ours was even nicer, as it was very quiet facing onto the internal countyard, and had it's own kitchen with hobs and microwave (we did not use), cutlery, plates and more. The mini-bar was well stocked and the room had the usual internet, international TV etc which we also did not use. The breakfast was really varied, really good quality and fresh, serving a range of hot and cold items including the usual eggs, meats and fruits/cereals, savoury and sweet and a great range of drinks including to my satisfaction some vitamin drink tablets. The only slight draw back although it didnt bother us too much was that the lovely shower was over a bath that could be seen by a large glass panel from the bedroom, so unless you purposely averted your eyes or lied on the bed you could look at the other person showering. Luckily myself and my friend are quite comfortbale with this, as I would be with my girlfriend, but more reserved or older guests might find this a bit off-putting. Might be a good idea to use frosted glass even. Still a perfect hotel for me, no fuss, perfect location (inbetween kreuzberg and friedrichshain), clean, friendly, and for me incredibly good value. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: katieanderson19
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! I stayed here last week with my boyfriend for a long weekend trip to Berlin. The hotel is very clean, the service is very good and the rooms are lovely. The rooms are big, spacious and well lit. The bathroom is also big and very clean. The beds are comfortable and the heating was excellent. (it was -3 when we were there!) The mini bar isnt too expensive either and is stocked everyday if you use any of its contents. The hotel is just beside the S-Bahn and can easily move in-out of town. Getting the S-Bahn to Alexanderplatz really meant we could see everything without any trouble. The trams come so often anyway that there isn't a need for a taxi. The east side gallery of the Berlin Wall is just around the corner which was a fantastic discovery and clubs such as Watergate/Berghain are also very near. (Must go to both-it was AMAZING!) Overall a great hotel, would stay again and would defo recommend anyone to stay there too!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Supergrannieisgreat
Reviews.Content: A super modern hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Our room was bigger than we expected, I thInk we were upgraded. THE BATHROOM SHOWER WAS GREAT - BEAM ME UP SCOTTY!I felt a bit vulnerable walking from the station to the hotel when it was dark but that was the only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet&stylish”
Reviews.Author: AlexsaGP
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect place where to stay if need silence and to stay apart form crowded center. Faultless service and location. Enjoyable style make senses about something kind of outstanding. I do recommend:)

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Batd2
Reviews.Content: Really nice and modern hotel. One of the best I have seen. It is really good location for a Berlin visitor. Very close to a central station. I am not sure how was it price-wise as I had a cheap deal through lastminute.com.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Russell1973
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very easy to find from ostbahnhof. Clean and comfotable rooms and very helpful reception. Breakfast if not included is 19 Euros per person and is a bit steep! Ideally you need to use the U-Bahn to get to the centre of Berlin of face a 30 minute plus stroll

Reviews.Title: “Stillish and Chic but oh too, too warm....!!”
Reviews.Author: LizzzzyZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 5 day stay at the InnSide Hotel in Berlin. We were in Berlin over the Xmas Holidays and returned home on New Year's Eve. Whilst this hotel is very stylish, chic and very clean we did experience only minor problems. Mainly the heat!! The hotel room was too hot and we had to push the window wide open even though it was below zero outside! The bed squeaked badly whenever you moved around. The gym was very disappointing with very little in the way of equipment and also the heat was on full-blast. The corridors were dark and you needed to put the light back on if you were walking through. It was like a maze to find the hotel rooms - more a fault in the design of the hotel. The hotel is built around a courtyard which in the summer I imagine is quite pretty. The hotel is also located next too some Conference Facilities but as this was in the middle of the Christmas and New Year period, this was not in use. I imagine during any other time of the year, this is quite full of business people. The hotel room was very nicely layed out but a bit office-ish with a large desk and a set of drawers like you find at work!! The shower was uber-trendy. Word of caution - do not go to this hotel and stay in a room who you are not intermit with. It is a glass cubicle in the centre of the room!! Literally! Not sure if all the rooms are like this but the picture on the web-site indicates so. The breakfast was of good variety with plenty of topping up of the buffet table though the staff did struggle as the hotel was fully-booked. So much so, guests had to eat breakfast in the bar area - and that was smokey. But it was so hot in the breakfast area!! Indeed in the winter you do tend to dress slightly warmer than if you are on a summer holiday but it was too hot to eat in comfort. We had 1 drink in the hotel bar on arrival and found this very expensive and never returned. The lobby area was also well heated - so the cold hit really hard when you walked outside. The hotel is located 5 min walk from the train/metro station and connections are very regular. 5 min ride to Alexanderplatz. Though we pretty much walked our way around Berlin, we used the metro to get us to our starting point each day. Not much going on in the area but very quiet with a few shops, a department store, a Netto and a small market in the square. Overall, a good hotel but please turn the heat to a lower setting and very clean. The staff very much German and to-the-point!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for nothing”
Reviews.Author: faruz
Reviews.Content: Well.. it was really expensive for what we've got. A really small room and an even bigger problem with no air conditioning. (We were told that no room has any). Another problem was that I was travelling with my friend and there's no bathroom door so it was really awkward for us... The location on the other hand, is amazing. Just outside OstBahnhof with quick transportation everywhere in Eastern Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mike463502
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Berlin with my fiance and a couple of friends. We booked this hotel through a website that offered 3 rooms and tickets to the Berlin soccer team's weekend game. We really weren't sure of what to expect because the price was quite cheap but we ended up being very surprised to having recieved a very nice hotel room. The hotel seems very new and the rooms were very clean, spacious, and modern. I was very impressed by this because most hotels in Europe are a little on the small and older side. The hotel is also only about 200 meters from the east train station so you have direct access to almost anywhere in Berlin from there. The only problems I would say we had was that the reception people were not the friendliest by far. Also I would recommend skipping the dinner at the hotel restaurant. They served a very good buffet breakfast but the dinner was over priced and not very tasty at all. But that was ok because we weren't forced to eat there so we just had dinner out on the town. So after all this I would recommend this hotel and would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “good experience, be realistic about gym”
Reviews.Author: vaxx
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying at the Innside through a lastminute.com package and was quite satisfied with the hotel. My single room was very nicely decorated, looked new, the heating was warm and the overall feel was clean, trendy and comfortable. Absolutely no problems with the bed or shower/bath and the room was a decent size. I notice there was a door leading next door so you could book two adjoining rooms if you wanted to. Location: when you get off at Ostbahnhof station exit on the north side. To your left you will see a Dresdner Bank building. The hotel is in that building but you need to walk around to the north side to get in. Basically it's five minutes walk. I walked through the area at about 5am and it was a bit spooky but there were a number of all night diner places next to the station. Look up the hotel's website which has directions how to get to the hotel from different airports around Berlin. It takes about 5 mins by the fast elevated train service to get to Alexanderplatz and about 15 minutes to the Zoo. The journey to/from Tegel airport is about 45 mins. Shopping: there is a big department store right outside the station and there are also 2 supermarkets and a drug store, cash machines, fast food joints in the station building itself. For general shopping I recommend catching the train over to the west Berlin surburb of Charlottenburg where you can find a great range of high street shops. One of the reasons I chose Innside was because the description of facilities said there was a fitness centre on-site. Well that turned out to be a bit of a disappointment - basically there is a step machine, exercise bike, gliding machine and an abs frame plus a set of free weights and a bench. Enough for a maintenance workout but dont expect to add any muscle while you are there. Also in the fitness area is a sauna and a solarium which costs about 6 euro for 30 mins. On the map it says there is a swimming pool a block near to the hotel, I didnt go myself but handy to know if you need to exercise while on vacation like me. Basically, a good experience at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “great advantages for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: Makerere
Reviews.Content: This hotel, a beautifully converted late-19th-century hotel and part of a chain, has great advantages for the budget traveler. The rooms are spacious, scrupulously clean and well maintained, with more chairs and reading lamps than most hotels have, sleek bathroom features, and a handy mini-kitchen. It is half a block from the Galleria Kaufhof, a big department store with an excellent food department. We made our own breakfasts as well as some (very simple) dinners. The staff are young, bright, and informative; the front desk often offers apples or cookies at the end of the day. The hotel is in East Berlin, very near the Ostbahnhof, where a number of S-Bahn lines converge, so it's convenient for getting around (Alexanderplatz is a couple of stops away). The Ostbannhof also has, either inside or across the street, a wide array of fast-food places, bakeries, fruit-and-vegetable stands, and the like. The neighborhood is an expectedly dreary example of an East Berlin residential area; the advantage of this is that you see ordinary Berliners trudging home with their groceries, kids on an outing from a day-care center, and other such details of local life. Some people would prefer to be in a more trendy, hopping part of town, which is why I didn't opt for "excellent." Most of the guests are business people, but on weekends Germans arrive for brief holidays.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable last-minute choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked kind of late, but were pleasantly surprised by Innside. The room was cramped but clean...interesting decor. The immediate surroundings are nothing special, but many will appreciate the Friedrichshain neighborhood east of the hotel, perhaps the most vibrant part of Berlin. The walk over to the Friedrichshain is intriguing...this part of town is not short on Cold War-era bulwarks. The other major advantage of Innside is its proximity to the Ostbahnhof metro and train station, a huge hub...this comes in very handy considering Berlin's massive area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stylish hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: WillyWonka1
Reviews.Content: I stayed inthis hotel for 3 nights, the hotel was fantastic, really clean spacious rooms. Our room overlooked the courtyard and the rooom was just lovely and the shower pod was amusing!!! The only thing i was a bit dissapointed in was the fact that it was not in walking distance of any of the lively places. But this did not end up being a problem as the train staion was literally around the corner and it only took a few mins to get to Alexandarplatz which was great. I think the hotel was fab and it was so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: kickasskandy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through lastminute.com, which promised a 4 star hotel for a bargain price and I wasn't dissappointed. this is a seruously cool hotel with ace decor and fantastic rooms - ours had abstract art as a headboard and a huge shower in the middle of the room. Most rooms have a mini kitchen which was good for storing beers and food and the rooms were pretty big and airy. The staff were helpful with directions from the airport and let us leave our luggage there until check in and were helpful and polite during our stay. The sauna and fitness facilites were good as was the bar - the only thing i would say wasn't the best was the fact we had to request tea bags three times - british people are obsessed with tea hehe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: f999
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Inn-Side hotel in Berlin for 4 days during October 2004. It’s a fantastic hotel with large, clean rooms. However, the hotel is made extra-special by the modern design touches throughout. The location is perfect – don’t let the fact that its in the Eastern part of the city put you off. Alexanderplatz is perfectly walkable, and in any case the Ostbahnof station is less than a minute away, so travel to the Western parts is only a 10 minute train ride (and trains seems to leave every 2 minutes…). Overall, I wouldn’t hesitate to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cutting edge design”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm R
Reviews.Content: A blend of the old (the building used to be a textile factory) with the new (21st century shower "pod") make this an unusual place to stay. Only 2 minutes walk from Ostbahnhof and 5 from the East Side Gallery, with service of the sort you don't expect in Germany, and a good restaurant thrown in, this is a real find. Great value for money if you get a deal.

HotelInfo.Name: Innside Premium Hotels Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Lange Strasse 31, 10243 Berlin, Germany
